title: Re-add uploaded Demo & Media image asset so it loads in production

requirements.text: Add the newly uploaded image file "WhatsApp Image 2026-02-06 at 9.23.49 AM-1.jpeg" to the frontend static assets and ensure the Demo & Media section loads it correctly in production by matching the exact path referenced by `frontend/src/siteConfig.ts` (`media.images` currently includes `assets/whatsapp-image-2026-02-06-092349.jpeg`). If necessary, rename/copy the uploaded image to `frontend/public/assets/whatsapp-image-2026-02-06-092349.jpeg` so the deployed build contains the asset at that path.

quotes: The user has uploaded 1 image(s): WhatsApp Image 2026-02-06 at 9.23.49 AM-1.jpeg.

acceptanceCriteria: The repository contains `frontend/public/assets/whatsapp-image-2026-02-06-092349.jpeg` (from the uploaded image, either via rename or copy).

In `frontend/src/siteConfig.ts`, `siteConfig.media.images` continues to reference a path that exists in `frontend/public` at build time (either unchanged if `assets/whatsapp-image-2026-02-06-092349.jpeg` is created, or updated to the actual shipped filename).

When the app is built and deployed under a non-root base path, the Demo & Media image renders without triggering the "Image failed to load" fallback in `frontend/src/components/sections/DemoMediaSection.tsx`.
Clicking the image opens the full-size image in a new tab (existing behavior remains working).

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`, `frontend/src/components/ui`.
Keep backend as a single-actor Motoko canister; no backend changes are required for this request.
nonGoals: No changes to the contact form flow or Motoko backend logic.
No new landing-page sections or navigation changes beyond what is required to make the demo image load.
